meanings.definition: A schedule or plan that lists the times at which certain events or activities are intended to take place.
meanings.sent1: My school has a timetable that tells us when each class starts and ends.
meanings.sent2: I always check the timetable to see when the next bus will arrive.
meanings.sent3: The timetable for the party was so detailed, it even included when we should start dancing!
meanings.sent4: Her life felt like a tightly packed timetable, with every minute planned out.
meanings.sent5: The timetable for the concert made sure every performer had their moment to shine.

meanings.definition: A chart showing the departure and arrival times of trains, buses, or airplanes.
meanings.sent1: The timetable at the train station helped me catch my train on time.
meanings.sent2: The airline emailed me the timetable for my flight so I knew when to arrive at the airport.
meanings.sent3: I wish my life had a timetable like the one for trains, so I wouldn't be late all the time!
meanings.sent4: The timetable of life can sometimes be unpredictable, just like the arrival of a delayed train.
meanings.sent5: Staring at the timetable, I felt a sense of order and direction in the chaos of travel.
